question: Which segment is used to store interrupt and subroutine return address registers?

What is the output of the following program?

#define BIT3(0x1<<3)
static int a=17;
void main()
{
printf('%x %x', a |= BIT3, a &= ~BIT3);
}

What is the output of the following program?

void main()
{
char *s[] = {'WISS','Software','Tech','Solutions'};
char **p;
p=s;
printf('%s',++*p);
printf('%s',*p++);
printf('%s ',++*p);
}

How many times is 'software developer' printed in the following program?

void main()
{
int x;
for(x=-1; x<=10; x++)
{
if(x < 5)
continue;
else
break;
print('software developer');
}
return 0;
}

What will be the output of the following program?

int main()
{
float f = 1.0;
int i1 = (int) f;
int i2 = *(int *)&f;
printf('%d\n', i1);
printf('%s\n', i2);
}

What is the output of the following code?

int main()
{
float a = 1.1;
double b = 1.1;
if(a == b)
printf('software developer');
else
printf('ML developer');
}

What is the output of the following program when 'Winger IT' is passed as an argument?

#include
#include
int main(int argc, char *argv[])
{
int flag = 0;
char passwd[10];
memset(passwd, 0, sizeof(passwd));
strcpy(passwd, argv[1]);
if (0 == strcmp('Smart', passwd))
{
flag = 1;
}
if (flag)
{
printf(' i am smart ');
}
else
{
printf(' i am intelleget ');
}
return 0;
}

{

printf(" [%c] ", *ptr++);
printf(" [%c] ", *ptr);

}

What is the output of the following program?

#include
int main(void)
{
int a = 10, b = 20, c = 30;
printf("\n %d,%d,%d\n", a + b + c, (b = b * 2), (c = c * 2));
return 0;
}

Using the variable x, which of the following defines an array of ten pointers to functions that take an integer argument and return an integer?

What is the output of the following program?

#include
union address {
char *name;
char street[10];
int pin;
};
int main() {
union address emp, *p;
emp.name = "Hu/Obli";
p = &emp;
printf("%s%s", p->name, (*p).name);
return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

#include
struct emp {
char *name;
int id;
};
int main() {
static struct emp e1 = {"A", 1}, e2 = {"B", 2}, e3 = {"C", 3};
struct emp (*array[]) = {&e1, &e2, &e3};
struct emp (*(*ptr)[3]) = &array;
printf("%s %d", (**(*ptr + 1)).name, (*(ptr + 1))->id);
return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

#include
int main(void) {
int a = 7;
int b = 1;
if (a >= b) {
int temp = a;
a = b;
b = temp;
}
printf("a=%d\tb=%d\n", a, b);
return 0;
}

for (; i < 2;) {
printf("%d", ++i);
}
}

#include

int *p = malloc(sizeof(int));
*p = 10;
free(p);
printf("%d", *p);

What is the output of the following program?

#include

int x = 5;
int y = 10;
int z = (x > y) ? x : y;
printf("%d", z);
return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

#include

int a = 0;
int b = 1;
int c = 2;
a = (b > c) ? b : c;
printf("%d %d %d", a, b, c);
return 0;
}
